get.summary: Get information about Workflow Execution Service.  May include information related (but not limited to) the workflow descriptor formats, versions supported, the WES API versions supported, and information about general the service availability.

List the workflows, this endpoint will list the workflows in order of oldest to newest.  There is no guarantee of live updates as the user traverses the pages, the behavior should be decided (and documented) by each implementation.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
OPTIONAL
Number of workflows to return at once. Defaults to 256, and max is 2048.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
OPTIONAL
Token to use to indicate where to start getting results. If unspecified, returns the first page of results.

parameters.name: key_value_search
parameters.description:
OPTIONAL
For each key, if the key's value is empty string then match workflows that are tagged with this key regardless of value.

post.summary: Run a workflow, this endpoint will allow you to create a new workflow request and retrieve its tracking ID to monitor its progress.  An important assumption in this endpoint is that the workflow_params JSON will include parameterizations along with input and output files.  The latter two may be on S3, Google object storage, local filesystems, etc.  This specification makes no distinction.  However, it is assumed that the submitter is using URLs that this system both understands and can access. For Amazon S3, this could be accomplished by given the credentials associated with a WES service access to a particular bucket.  The details are important for a production system and user on-boarding but outside the scope of this spec.

get.summary: Get detailed info about a running workflow
Get quick status info about a running workflow

name.title: The command line that was run

cmd.title: The command line that was run

stdout.title: Sample of stdout (not guaranteed to be entire log)

stderr.title: Sample of stderr (not guaranteed to be entire log)

location.title:
REQUIRED
location in long term storage, is a url specific to the implementing
system. For example s3://my-object-store/file1 or gs://my-bucket/file2 or
file:///path/to/my/file

type.title:
REQUIRED
Type of data, "Parameter", "File" or "Directory"
if used for an output all the files in the directory
will be copied to the storage location

ga4gh_wes_parameter.description: Parameters for workflows or tasks, these are either output parameters, files, or directories, the latter two are stagged to an object store or something similar for hand back to the caller.

workflow_type_versions.title: A map with keys as the workflow format type name (currently only CWL and WDL are used although a service may support others) and value is a workflow_type_version object which simply contains an array of one or more version strings

supported_wes_versions.title: The version(s) of the WES schema supported by this service

supported_filesystem_protocols.description: The filesystem protocols supported by this service, currently these may include common protocols such as 'http', 'https', 'sftp', 's3', 'gs', 'file', 'synapse', or others as supported by this service.

engine_versions.title: The engine(s) used by this WES service, key is engine name e.g. Cromwell and value is version

system_state_counts.description: The system statistics, key is the statistic, value is the count of workflows in that state. See the State enum for the possible keys.

key_values.title: a key-value map of arbitrary, extended metadata outside the scope of the above but useful to report back

ga4gh_wes_service_info_request.title: Blank request message for service request

ga4gh_wes_workflow_desc.title: Small description of workflows, returned by server during listing

page_size.description:
OPTIONAL
Number of workflows to return at once. Defaults to 256, and max is 2048.

page_token.description:
OPTIONAL
Token to use to indicate where to start getting results. If unspecified, returns the first page of results.

key_value_search.title:
OPTIONAL
For each key, if the key's value is empty string then match workflows that are tagged with this key regardless of value

ga4gh_wes_workflow_list_request.title: Request listing of jobs tracked by server

workflow_log.title: the logs, and other key info like timing and exit code, for the overall run of this workflow

task_logs.title: the logs, and other key info like timing and exit code, for each step in the workflow

workflow_descriptor.title:
REQUIRED
the workflow CWL or WDL document

workflow_params.title:
REQUIRED
the workflow parameterization document (typically a JSON file), includes all parameterizations for the workflow including input and output file locations

workflow_type.title:
REQUIRED
the workflow descriptor type, must be "CWL" or "WDL" currently (or another alternative supported by this WES instance)

workflow_type_version.title:
REQUIRED
the workflow descriptor type version, must be one supported by this WES instance

key_values.title:
OPTIONAL
a key-value map of arbitrary metadata outside the scope of the workflow_params but useful to track with this workflow request

workflow_type_version.title: an array of one or more version strings

ga4gh_wes_workflow_type_version.title: available workflow types supported by this WES
